definition: to include impromptu comic material in opera performance (idiom); to jest/buffoonery
to insert/stick in/pierce/to take part in/to interfere/to interpose

sentences.english: The clown panicked the audience with a gag.
sentences.chinese: 小丑插科打諢逗得觀衆大笑。

sentences.english: Percussion performances contrast, gag, noise called into play.
sentences.chinese: 表演時鑼鼓烘托，插科打諢，喧呼成戲。

sentences.english: The actor gagged up his part in the comedy.
sentences.chinese: 這個演員在所“扮演”的喜劇角色中插科打諢。

sentences.english: The young man would always cut up if there were any girls.
sentences.chinese: 那個年輕人一遇到姑娘總是插科打諢。

sentences.english: Jack likes to cut up in class.
sentences.chinese: 傑克喜歡在上課的時候插科打諢。

sentences.english: Each gag was rewarded with a generous belly-laugh.
sentences.chinese: 每一次插科打諢都引來一陣開懷大笑。
